Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Montreal late in the evening and needed a place to crash before picking up a car and starting our vacation the next morning. The Marriott at the airport looks really nice, but the prices reflect that. Aloft is the W Hotel chain's budget brand and it's the first time I had stayed in one. This place was clean, modern, stylish, and quite comfortable. The room was well laid out with a really nice bathroom and dressing area. The sleeping area had a nice large TV, big windows, only one little desk and chair but that's ok for a quick stay. I guess the ONLY annoyance was that the bright light of the Sheraton hotel sign nearby glowed into our room, but the window shades blocked that out. The lobby bar looked nice, and there's a take-out cafe where we got breakfast - the bagel sandwich was delicious. A shuttle between the terminal and the hotel runs every fifteen minutes and only takes about 5 minutes to make the trip. Based on this I would definitely stay in an Aloft hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “much nicer than the average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxpress
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. It doesn't really look or feel like an airport hotel (we all know what soulless places those can be). Lovely staff at reception, a very nice bar. The rooms are great as well. Wish more airport hotels were like this!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, modern, QUIET hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: LeftTheBldg
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels through the years around Dorval (Pierre Elliot Trudeau Airport) this and Novotel are my two favourite hotels. Was a bit difficult to drive there from the airport due to ongoing road construction, but can't fault the hotel for that. However, the hotel does offer a shuttle service. Room was clean, modern, and with a comfortable bed. Bathroom is modern. Sliding floor to ceiling mirror is the door which separates the toillet / shower stall from the rest of the bathroom. No bathtub. Fine by me. I take showers. Great sound insulation. I didn't hear any planes. The one area it does falter is the lack of a restaurant. It's got this 24/7 self-serve style snack bar. They serve a hot breakfast there, but I can't comment on it. Didn't eat there. If taking the shuttle to the hotel, then you're kind of stuck with this only dining option. There's another hotel walking distance (forgot which one) and presume they have a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish rooms, be sure to bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Sheraton guest, was excited to try this novel SPG brand. Pros: -Gorgeous lobby and bar area, very trendy with calming tones. -Staff very friendly and welcoming. Fast check-in. -Chic rooms with simple European design, sure to please those with a modern taste. -Everything was clean. -Nice LG 37" LCD TV with ~50 channels (no HD), including commercial-free movie channel 60. -Great soundproofing of windows, planes are a modest hum even on the top (5th) floor. Would only disturb the highly-sensitive sleeper who should be using earplugs anyway. -Blinds black out the room 100%, light will never interrupt your sleep here. -Nice in-room lighting system. -Free internet and Ipod/camera hookups to TV. -In-room safe. -Bed is a bit firmer than most, but relatively comfortable. -Close to airport/AMT train system to downtown Montreal. The infrequent yet efficient AMT takes 20 minutes, 4 stops total, goes directly to the Bell Centre and costs $4.25 each way (pay for zone 1). -All rooms include a quiet stainless steel mini-fridge. -Contrary to prior feedback, the silent vintage alarm clock made no ticking noise. -Wonderful shower with stylish tiling (pressure a bit weak for water conservation) and logical pump system for shampoo/douche to reduce waste. Plush towels. -Indoor pool/fitness and and public area was very well-maintained. -Express check-out. Cons: -Biggest issue: soundproofing of entry door to hallway/adjoining rooms. 1" gap at bottom of door doesn't help. With the hotel only 30% full, still woke at 4.20am to a loud conversation and repeated door slams from a room two doors down. Problem is augmented by the acoustics of the room with cement ceiling/walls. -Thermostat not very reliable. Was 16 upon entry, upon setting to 20, it wouldn't turn on. Had to set to 23 to get it going and the room was blazing hot within 30 minutes. Reset back to 20 and woke up cold with a sore throat, as it evidently shut off for the night. -Bar was closed by 11pm, even on the weekend. -Beds and sink are very low, impractical for anyone over 5'10". -Two pillows provided on king bed are large, spongy and cylinder-shaped. Very uncomfortable, as they prop your head up to a 90-degree angle, hard on the neck. The two normal thin rectangular pillows were hidden above the curtain in the bathroom area. -Only in-room chair is the low-back work desk chair with minimal tilt-back, thus no relaxing recline chair for the evening (could have one on far side of the room). -In-room coffee packets are tiny and bland. -Walls are devoid of any artwork. One colorful print would really help. -Bill under door upon check-out was 90% in French, though I could figure out it has express check-out if you agree with all charges, including $10/day parking. Not directly their fault, but note: -Tons of construction in the area, the misaligned roads and poor signage make it awkward to get to even with a GPS. Overall, the Aloft Montreal is a hotel with good intentions but several areas of improvement that hopefully they will act upon.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: The Aloft Montreal is all you can expect from an airport hotel. A clean room with a comfortable bed. The Aloft brand is a no-frill chain from Starwood, but with a little twist to it. The rooms have modern designs, with nice large showers and IT connections such Ipod base. I arrived relatively late and left quite early, but the room did its job. Internet is free, and they have regular free shuttle to the airport. My best choice around is the Marriott as it is connected to the terminal, but the Aloft provides a cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and cool!”
Reviews.Author: edmstudentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a romantic Valentine's Day getaway (I live 10 minutes away in Lachine). The hotel was perfect. I liked the modern decor, it was impeccably clean and the bed very comfortable. I just wish we didn't have to leave so early in the morning to go to work. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Montreal Airport”
Reviews.Author: Torquay102010
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the hotel - large, bright rooms and comfortable beds. However, despite good insulation, I would recommend earplugs if you are sensitive to noise, as some planes come very close. There is no restaurant, but some food is available for purchase. They have a breakfast buffet for $10. Shuttle service every 15 minutes starting at 5am; the driver of the shuttle was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist style, minimal all around”
Reviews.Author: Rob G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at three hotels near the Montreal airport: the Aloft, Sheraton and Novotel and Aloft. Aloft is equivalent to the Novotel in terms of the room size, style and soundproofing (minimalist) Quite nice and appealing to me. The Sheraton is more like you would expect a normal hotel room to be like. Where the Aloft fails to impress is on the food side. I arrived early evening and there was nothing in terms of restaurants only a refrigerator in the recption with salad and drinks and a bar with snacks. There is also a smoothy bar (closed at night) which I assume is for breakfast. I actually walked the 200 feet across the road to the Sheraton for food. If you want to eat a meal when you arrive and a nice room skip Aloft and head to Novotel where the food is exceptional. It's worth the drive around he other side of the airport. If you just need a nice room to crash in that is very close to the airport terminal Aloft is fine.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel works”
Reviews.Author: wineo1946
Reviews.Content: The Aloft at Durval is not large or fancy but has everything one needs at an airport hotel; clean, quiet and convenient. It is more minimalistic modern but does have a small pool and exercise area, a well stocked bar and an adequate breakfast to go. The shuttle runs every fifteen minutes and takes about five. Contrary to a prior review I did not hear airplane or other noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel five minutes from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Palmsandbeaches
Reviews.Content: We onernighted here making connections from Punta Cana and Winnipeg. The hotel is very trendy with sophisticated decor and huge rooms with fabulous bathrooms. No real restaurant although there is a breakfast buffet with eggs and omelettes and such and a lobby bar with a decent food menu. It was the perfect place to rest up between legs of our trip. Loved the floating sink.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for a quiet night”
Reviews.Author: Greg K
Reviews.Content: I read promising reviews on Trip Advisor and when looking for an overnight stay close to the airport after a recent business trip in Montreal, I booked at A loft. Being a Thursday night and having meetings the next morning, I was looking forward to a good night sleep. While the room was comfortable, with that funky edge that Aloft does, I had no idea the sound proofing from the lobby bar to the rooms was so poor. I was located on the second floor and could hear every last note of the very loud music and voices coming from the lobby bar below! I may rethink things if staying on the weekend where a quiet night sleep is not so important, but I will certainly pass on Aloft on my next business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Close to airport but No Food Options in the Evening”
Reviews.Author: SwivelBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, arriving at 10pm from Vancouver, BC and leaving early the next morning for our final vacation destination. The hotel is modern and has a nice lounge. The room was perfect for the two of us (even if we were staying longer) - the frosted glass wall from the shower into the bedroom was a cheeky/nice addition. We found our room quiet, and I think our shuttle was free back to the airport. I recommend if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice; Close to Airport (but not connected)”
Reviews.Author: bellboycary
Reviews.Content: PROs: Close to airport; modern/clean feel; free aiport shuttle CONs: Airport noise, bright lights at night, limited eating options; 10-15 minute wait for free shuttle Overall, this is a very good airport hotel. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful (thank you). Lobby The lobby is fairly lodge with places to sit, a pool table, several computers (at least one for printing off your boarding pass), a coffee machine, and an open refridgerator with drinks and pre-made salads and sandwiches (although the selection was limited). There is a bar that opens up in the evening. Room The room was spacious, clean, and uses 'modern'-sytle furniture. Bathroom was spacious with a walk-in shower (no tub). Shower uses soap/shampoo dispensers rather than pre-packaged soap/shampoo. Certainly a 'loft' apartment feel to the room. Bed was comfortable enough. There is a small fridge in the room (although it is noisy). Had to shut the blinds completely at night as the outside lights were bright. Location Close to the aiport although not connected. There is a free shuttle that appears to come around every 10-20 minutes. Not a lot of dining options immediately near the hotel. The Sheraton is immediately next door to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist chique taken one detail too far”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAnge
Reviews.Content: Love the vibe at this hotel. Felt very European. Awesome shower, simple closet, big bench for luggage instead of silly dressers and drawers. No restaurant, but short walk across the street to get to the Sheraton. Calling the front desk for a new wireless code everyday was a pain...but the one thing that annoyed me was the lack of additional toilet tissue. After I called and asked for more - they neglected to bring it up. Funny how hotel satisfaction comes down to the smallest details!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: businessman2000_11
Reviews.Content: Modern, conveniently located close to the airport and well priced hotel. Spacious and modern rooms, poorly appointed with 2 double beds (unfortunately one of them not clean). My biggest problem with this hotel was the cleaning (dirty bathroom tiles and floor) and towels located next to the toilet! The staff was not particularly helpful and I did not feel welcome there. By the way... hotel shuttle bus driver drove us through 3 parking lots before we got to the hotel! There are other hotels in the vicinity that I would like to try next time.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, trendy hotel very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: John_CornerBrook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aloft on our way home from a ski trip to Tremblant, and with an early am flight we needed a place close to the airport. We could not have been closer except by sleeping on the runway! Aloft is next door to the Sheraton (it shares a road entrance) and is just before the road to the airport itself. Flights are curtailed overnight, so noise was not a problem. Aloft is a new trendy chain in the Starwood Group, apparently focused on younger travellers.The decor is colourful and bright. Oddly, the ceilings are rough concrete simply painted, but it works! The building is well laid out, the rooms are attractive, the beds are comfortable and the staff are super friendly. The only minor drawback is that there is no restaurant in the building, but the staff do allow (perhaps even encourage?) guests to order food from local delivery restaraunts and eat that food in the bar area (it was not stated, but I assume they want you to order beverages at the bar - we did!). For early departures, they have a snack food, coffee and juice bar in the lobby, with everything at very reasonable prices The airport shuttle comes often, parking is available if you have a car and driving time to the departures level at Trudeau Airport is about 1 minute. It's that close!! We booked at a discount agency and got a great price. Even at posted rates, Aloft is good value.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: RickandCathy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aloft for an overnight stay on January 7, 2012 as we had an early morning flight out of Trudeau airport. The hotel is very clean, front desk very efficient and the room was very comfortable. We booked this hotel on expedia because the price was very affordable and we would not hesitate to recommend it . The hotel has a little snack area on the ground floor next to reception which has coffee and snack foods. It does not have a restaurant, but for a quick overnight stay it is really not needed. It has free 24 hour shuttle service to and from the airport which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: eerzaweepieanbovril
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, rooms were clean and seemed well maintained, they were a reasonable size and had somewhat of a European feel about them although I don't know that I would want to stay for longer than a couple of nights as closet and drawer space are very limited, every thing just seemed to be little cubby holes. Found the staff at the hotel bar very friendly hand out a nice tip and the free pour drinks just keep getting better and better, problem here is if you want to eat something, the bar does have snack food which is not that bad but if you would like a nice meal you are out of luck, another reason you really don't want to stay for more than two nights as you are a good drive to any reasonable restaurant Real close to the airport so really handy for early morning flights or if you have meetings close by. Would I stay here again ? Yes I guess but only for location and no more than two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good airport location”
Reviews.Author: natlaj
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with the service. We arrived at the hotel and there was no one at the very messy desk, unprofessional looking. My biggest issue with no one being at the desk is that they had not logged out of the system, this is a security issue. When the guy finally arrived, he did not apologize, he just asked if we were checking in. He checked me in to a room two doors down from the pool table and the bar, very noisy. I asked for a room change and he gave us a room on the second floor above the entrance, not the best yet better than the first one. My real issues: The body lotion bottle was empty The water bottles had been refilled with tap water The phone by the bed did not work at all The phone on the desk worked if you used the base and not the hand held unit, it started beeping in the middle of the night. The clock was unplugged, unprofessional, plug it back in and set the time, I should not have too None of these things are huge issues alone, all of them together indicates to me that they have a lousy housekeeping department. No reason for any of these issues. The hotel does look tired for a hotel that open not that long ago. For the people complaining that it is far from the City Centre, you are correct, do your homework and you would have known this, it is an airport hotel. As far as the rooms are concerned, they are exactly what they promote. You donâ€™t like modern, donâ€™t go there. The bed is low, we found it comfortable and slept well until the phone started beeping. The blackout shades are amazing, best I have ever had. The shower spacious with good water pressure. It is a loft hotel. Hard to find due to construction.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nolikewinter
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located to the airport for those short overnight stays for early morning connecting flights with frequent (shared) shuttle buses departing from Post/Stop 3 (important to know). Rooms are large and basically furnished with a very comfortable king size bed with quality sheets and towels. The only negatives would be that the somewhat noisy heating unit comes on and off throughout the (short) nightand the food is snack bar type - better to eat at the airport. Overall, good value for the convenience and location.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Urban”
Reviews.Author: kevenv
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before flying south. Great location, free shuttle to/from the airport. Left my car there for a week. Rooms are modern and surprise surprise.... loft like! Very nice bath and shower.Certainly our style. The only reason not a 5 was the bag breakfast is kind of weak. Other than that, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Otto H
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay last weekend in # 216 ; pleasant check in around 11:00pm ,unfortunately the bar was closed ?... The room was modern and "different". The bed very comfortable..great shower. The AC was noisy and so was the mini-fridge..could be the echo in the room ? Unfortunately the carpet was also stained in a number of places. It was very difficult to open the coffee pouch, thanks to my trusted Swiss knife.

Reviews.Title: “Modern looking”
Reviews.Author: gatine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hotwire's choice. Barely spent 7 hours there as we arrived late in the morning. I liked the design of this hotel, the proximity to the airport, the free wifi. It was quiet and comfy. I just wished they were offering toasts or something in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: BMWBMW
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights--July 1-4, 2011 At the Airport area, with easy access to highway to travel around to various parts of Montreal and its suburbs, there was no airplane noise. Nice modern style hotel without bathtubs. U shape hotel with court yard inside the U-shape, noise was caught inside. Therefore, it can get noisy with young folks drinking late into the night and with drunken folks yelling late into the night. Overall nice hotel and priced reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: _PheobeK_
Reviews.Content: The hotel, room and service were very nice. Wireless service was available.The room was very sleek and modern. Beautiful shower and bathroom area, very clean, comfortable king sized bed, great layout, however; pricey for the location. There is nothing around the hotel at all. Additionally, the taxi trip from the airport to the hotel cost $24.00 for a 5 (yes 5) minute drive in circles to get to it. It would be a great location for a layover, but that would be it...

Reviews.Title: “Thanks but no thanks”
Reviews.Author: DavidatTarget
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to be close to the airport and regretted not paying the extra $90 to stay at the Marriott attached to the airport. The computers availabe to check-in for my flight were very difficult to read (terrible color contrast) and after spending 10 minutes navigating my way through these "un"-user friendly terminals, failed to produce a copy of my boarding pass as they must have been out of paper. I retired to my room only to find that it had been decorated straight out of "Warsaw Pact-era chic" of gray walls and industrial blue carpeting, with the entry area swathed in a version that appeared straight out of Wal-mart (except the blue color). The lighting was either bright or non-existent and my bed was made so that the top sheet didn't even enclose the mattress and I had to re-make it so my feet did not stick out the bottom. While being located adjacent to the airport, there are no signs indicating how to return and given potential traffic tie-ups in this very congested city, you do not want to leave anything to chance. Needless to say it took us over 20 minutes to get to the terminal - our bad, next time we'll ditch the car and take the shuttle (hopefully they won't get lost). Despite teh bad environment, the staff were both helpful and friendly and did their best to overcome the sub-par rooms and other amenities. Our check-in was friendly and accommodating and looked up our Starwood accounts without any prompting and the bartender was very outgoing and helpful. She also provided some helpful recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight layover while travelling”
Reviews.Author: Milli
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for a 6-7 hour layover between flights and as I poured over the hotels I was looking for value and accomodations for a quick sleep close to the airport. I did not want to pay a lot for amenities that we would not use but did want a pleasant atmosphere and clean and comfortable accomodations. This hotel caught my eye with it's simple and efficient modern look. It did not disappoint and I would definitely book again for an overnight layover. We arrived around 1:00 AM from our flight and were quickly checked in. The beds were very comfortable with their pillow tops and fluffy duvets. I found the simplicity of the rooms and the great use of space to be very calming after about 8 hours of travel and airports. Our wake up call came on time and check out was very quick. Excellent Value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, unique, convenient, sleek, modern”
Reviews.Author: MNRJSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight as I was in transit. Aloft exceeded all of my expectations. The rooms were unique, the whole hotel wasn't stale but sleek, modern, beautiful to look at, with a nice pool and gym. I also have indoor allergies, and the air in the rooms was wonderful. Even though I was just in transit, I had a superb relaxing time here and would definitely stay here again. It was just a couple of minutes from the terminals as well so super convenient. Not a cookie cutter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: SebnVero
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the night before my wedding and the night right before our honeymoon. What a great modern hotel. The bar manager was kind enough to let me use his bar for my wedding preparation photo shoot. And the rest of the staff made my stay as easy and comfortable as possible. I would'nt go anywhere else if I need to catch an early flight. Shuttle was there at the time we requested the night before and 3 mins. later we were at the airport. Nice lounge area, with a pool table and a nice outdoor area to realx at night. Great hotel and superbly managed.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern. Comfortable. Accessible.”
Reviews.Author: Bluegoosebach
Reviews.Content: A great place right near the airport. Styling is very modern and the rooms are very comfortable. No full service restaurant but it is just across the street in a Sheraton. Check the location where you catch the shuttle bus. It is NOT where almost all shuttle buses come so be sure before you go. I asked them to put it on their reservation confirmation message.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome concept, stylish decor and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing you would expect from a ordinary hotel. It is focussed on fun alternative. The lobby is packed with lots of stuff such as a great snack bar, pool table, lots of seating area, internet access with programs such as office products. This hotel has a swimming pool and a state of the art Gym, TV in most cardio machine. Room are kind of small in size but the layout make use of all space greatly. Hotel is right next to airport but aircraft depart and arriving is not a problem since hotel is as sound proof as you can get, inside and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great start for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Cilnia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Modern, very close to the airport, 5min with the free shuttle. The bar is beautifull and the drinks are great. Go get breakfast at the Sheraton instead of having it at the Aloft, it's next door and it's a very good buffet breakfast instead of the snacks the have at the hotel. Caroline at the front desk and Vidal at the bar were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern place near the airport”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: The Aloft is a really nice, modern hotel that sits in a web of expressways, construction and airport traffic just outside of downtown Montreal QC. The lobby is huge, with a modern bar and very tall ceilings. The front desk is in the middle, circular, and contributes to the cool, modern layout, The receptionist was very friendly and accomodating. The room was also very modern looking. It was actually pretty small, but just perfect for a quick stay between a long business trip and a morning shuttle to the airport. The shower had one glass wall that backed up to the bedroom, and there were shelves and storage just opposite the sinks. The desk area of the main room was a little plain, with a place to set up the laptop, but that was about it. In the end, as I said, for a quick stay where you aren't spenidng much time in the room it's really nice. Any more than that and it might get a little crowded. It's certainly not a place you would choose for a romantic getaway or a family vacation! But I would stay there again under the same circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “A Badly Run Motel Disguised as a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sevak S
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before flying from the airport. I could not believe the lack of amenities - no glasses, one facecloth for 4 people and only 2 bath towels, no snack bar. Yet you could buy an amenity kit for $15!! The breakfast deal is terrible - a paper bag with a juice, croissant and an apple. The worst part was the careless check in where Claudio did not bother to explain any of the amenities of the hotel and then an error in their system showed our room was unoccupied. This meant the room was alotted to two other guests throughout the night, resulting in people trying to get into our room while I tried to get the most important thing before my flight - a good night's rest. My bill was not discounted as I had expected. There are good aspects to this hotel of course - the comfortable bed, nice shower and modern clean lines.

Reviews.Title: “Modernist Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: healey100
Reviews.Content: A nice alternative to traditional airport hotels. Nice room layout - lots of desk and bathroom vanity space. Limited closet space and no drawers - and - no glasses! Great snack area in the lobby - lots of lobby seating. Overall a great concept.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient,safe, and a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Vermontersvacation
Reviews.Content: Left our daughter there to catch an early flight out of YUL. Trendy, clean, safe, and a free shuttle to the airport. What's not to like!

Reviews.Title: “Small things add up to overall disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: DUpton
Reviews.Content: The Aloft hotel, Montreal airport, is located very close to the airport, but you couldn't tell as there was little to no noise from arriving or departing aircraft. The room was pretty small for the price charged and in my room, the phone handsets did not work and nobody was available to address it. Also, the tissue dispenser only had a couple of tissues in it and ran out. On the surface, each of the 3 are small issues, but combined, made my first experience at an Aloft hotel fall below expectations. I am returning to this hotel for my last night in Montreal and hopefully the experience is better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here twice over the past few weeks while en route to the east coast. We chose the Aloft because I am SPG Gold and because the Aloft accepts pets (AND at no charge, which is outstanding). Just remember to let them know well in advance that you are bringing a pet so they can block you off in a room on the ground floor. The rooms were decently clean, although the beds left a lot to be desired. Don't expect the usual outstanding beds found at other Starwood properties eg Westin Heavenly bed...the beds here don't come close to even Four Points standards. They should invest in easily removable and washable mattress covers instead of triple sheeting, in my opinion. However, I will give kudos for using fitted sheets. Also, the towels could use some fabric softener as they were like sandpaper. The shower was very good, and the provided bath products were very good. The $10 parking charge is just plain tacky, in my opinion. Not a bad place overall, and I would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Aloft ... more like alot (of room for improvement)”
Reviews.Author: LishoChicago
Reviews.Content: I travel every few months for business and am always looking for a hotel that's comfortable, clean, interesting (no Monet prints on the walls please) with a decent level of service at a reasonable price. When I traveled to Montreal recently, I was excited to stay at the new W concept - Aloft - which seems like a cheaper version of the W experience. Yes. and No. Bliss amenities are nice. Beds are comfortable enough, and the general atmosphere of the lobby is good. But here's the downside - the "loft" concept means lots of hard surfaces and high ceilings - resulting in a loud hotel room that honestly feels more like a combination dorm room/cheap Ikea knockoff. Service is reasonable, but unlike other hotels of the same ilk, offers a very limited menu. The hotel also does not have a business center, which posed a bit of a problem when I needed to print out a presentation (the woman at the front desk offered to print it for me if I emailed it to her, but the size of my presentation did not allow for it). And the springlike pillows (and general hotel noise) ensured a poor night's sleep. So, for the general Aloft concept - I'm not a fan. I could probably get beyond that if this specific hotel was exceptional in service or cleanliness, but the wear and tear of this place was surprising, given the age of the hotel. My room had stained and torn carpets, walls full of dings and dents, torn furniture and the housekeepers' hair on the counters. For the money, I think you can get a bigger and better experience in a Hyatt Place or in a newer Courtyard. All in all, I think I'll be looking for another place to stay on my next business trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Ch1sho1m
Reviews.Content: We needed a dog friendly hotel between West Island and downtown. Despite the construction right outside and being sandwiched between two major highways, the room was very quiet. I give it a 2 for location unless you want to be right at the airport, them it rates a 5. Clean, modern and roomy. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel49424
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one nite. Good business hotel; as mentioned earlier, the breakfast is a bit strange. They have the items set out like some sort of supermarket and you pay their inflated prices. They have a sort of community picnic table you can sit by--in case you want to get nice and close with your fellow guests (not!). Nice and modern but a free breakfast would be way more suitable. I don't care if it's modern or funky design, give me good value and include breakfast. On the plus side, they don't charge for parking and internet is free. Pool appeared pretty nice as well. Make sure you have good directions to get here; the highways are under construction and really sort of a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my first stay at an Aloft hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yuki_in_TO
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel to stay at near the airport in Montreal, just as a stopover on my drive between New Brunswick and Toronto. Whether you're driving through Montreal or you're flying in or out of the airport, this hotel is in a convenient location (will be more so when they finish the highway road construction). Loved the concept of the Aloft - modern yet practical and the room had everything I needed. Although there was no bath in my room (just a shower), it was a very roomy shower and there was lots of space in the washroom in general. The beds although at "European height" were very comfortable and the TV with the Plug In & Play Away docking station (to watch/listen your audio/video devices on the TV) is great to have for both individual travellers and families alike. Although I didn't take advantage of the lounge in the lobby, I liked the cafe bar concept where you can grab snacks and food to take to your room or on the road. I would definitely return to this hotel again if I return to this area. Service could have been a bit more friendly but they got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel Design - Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aloft at the Airport in Montreal August 12, 2011. The checkin was around 10:30 pm. There is a self check-in kiosk when you enter the building. We had a reserved room on the "pet floor" - which was on the ground level. I think I had my expectations too high because I expected to be greeted by staff either in the drive way or in the lobby asking to help with our bags. There were no porters to be found - so don't expect any. The lobby had an absolutely stunning modern design and I wish I had more time to spend admiring it. The rooms were also a very lovely design. There were no issues with cleanliness. The bathroom doesn't give much privacy as the door is on a track which allow it to roll closed. It does not lock, nor is it sound proofed. There didnt seem to be a fan in the bathroom either. The coffee in the room was terrible. I used the coffee maker to make one of the weakest coffees I have ever had. My friend is SPG Gold and we were told there was some sort of card for free coffee in the morning but we never saw this card. There was no SPG benefit in this hotel except a late checkout. There was a shower and no bath tub. This was fine by me but could be an issue for other guests. There are no mini shampoo bottles or bars of soap. There are mounted dispensers on the wall for the 2in1 shampoo/conditioner and body wash. I believe they should be providing a loofa/shower puff or something to lather the soap since there are no bars of soap to be found. My last problem with the room was the bed - there is no need for it to be so uncomfortable! After travelling for a day I would prefer a comfortable bed to relax in. All in all, I would stay here again. It is very aesthetically pleasing despite some issues & there were no charges to have my dog. I just need to lower my expectations a bit...

Reviews.Title: “A good pit-stop”
Reviews.Author: fstrdr
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a modern feel, with a minimalist decor. Bed is comfortable enough. I was disappointed that there was no tub in the room, after travelling all day. The other disadvantage is that there is no room service. We walked across the street, to another hotel, which had a restaurant on the main floor. Lots of renovation is happening around the property. There was too much black carpeting around the property, which makes dirty very noticeable. We almost got lost on the way to finding it due to bad street signage and road construction, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy - we were impressed”
Reviews.Author: MelandK
Reviews.Content: We were expecting an usual airport hotel room. You know the type of room that you are scared to sleep in the bed, take a shower, etc. We were very surprised by this hotel. Cool, trendy, nicely decorated, comfortable bed and cleaned room it is what you will get. The lobby, the bar and the pool areas are just great. Remember that you are just beside the airport so it's quite noisy but very convenient and cool. This hotel is an conception of the W hotels. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and not your typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheJohnStar
Reviews.Content: Stayed just for a quick night at the Aloft YUL Airport recently and this hotel was really like no other, airport hotel or otherwise! They certainly pride themselves as being unique and a real breath of fresh air for travellers. From the laid back, casual (but still professional) demeanor of their staff, to the contemporary furnishing and modern rooms, it was a great surprise! The rooms would definitely be described as oversized with generous bathrooms. The showers were just what you need on a short business trip and its worth mentioning it was a full stand up, not a tub. The beds hit the spot, and the black out blinds make a world of difference. The huge separated bathroom made getting ready early in the morning an easy task for two. The fridge, free water and complimentary magazines were nice touches that showed they wanted you to feel at home. Down at the bar, it was definitely more of a lounge. There is a long bar you can sit at thats very inviting with a backlit shelf area making for a very chic ambiance. But there is also a large number of tables, couches, sectionals and chairs so you can relax however you want! They have a small menu of finger foods that hit the spot with a few cocktails! The attention to detail on the drinks was also truly impressive. The bartender (Karen, I believe) got to know us on a first name basis and she truly rivaled bartenders at even the most upscale bars I've visited in Montreal. I just ordered a cosmo, and have to say its the best I've had. For a drink so common, its hard to make one stand out! Just outside the bar was a patio area that even looked inviting in the evening. That was also connected to a well equipped gym and a beautiful pool. Around the pool was all wood finishing and it smelled much more natural than the usual chlorine smell that greets you. Another reminder that they want you to truly feel at home. For a departure from your typical hotel, I would highly recommend the Aloft. Whether for a quick layover, or a longer stay, you will feel right at home. That's a feeling most hotels would kill to be able to deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lesoleil8
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay at Aloft. Duration: 2 nights with our little ones.Â  Location: near the airport/highway.Â  Service: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Extra towels were provided quickly after calling the front desk.Â  Room: 2 queen beds - extremely clean and modern with a loft like feel. Beds and pillows were comfy. Love the Bliss bath products, bar fridge and blackout blinds.Â  Pool and Gym: Bright and clean.Â  Â  Highs: Great roomsÂ  Lows: $10/day parking Our favorite place to stay while in MTL!

Reviews.Title: “Funky & modern hotel appealing to families & kids, great for a quick stopover near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: Patriciaychou
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Montreal at Aloft because we had an early flight to catch in the morning & wanted to avoid hitting any traffic or last minute rush. It worked out perfectly for us because Aloft offers airport shuttles every 10 minutes. I was told by the front desk clerk that this is the very first Aloft which is owned under the W Hotel group (AKA: Starwood) to appeal/attract the younger generation of travelers. You can tell easily by the design & concept as you enter the lobby with it's open bar & self-serve snack table. My teenage children loved the billiard/pool table & iMac workstations at their lounge. The hotel was also equipped with an indoor heated pool, work out gym with state-of-the-art equipments, and laundry facilities. I loved the layout with the courtyard setting next to the fireplace along with the big screen TV. The room itself is also designed in a very similar way with contemporary furniture and simplicity. The rolling blinds provides a good sleep, huge bathroom with complimentary Bliss toiletries. There's even a game console that allows you to hook your electronic gadgets to play on the big 42" flat screen TV. The only thing the hotel lacks is a descent restaurant & the nearest place to get any food would be either the Trudeau airport or the Sheraton next door. I would definitely recommend this hotel for short term stay or just an overnighter before catching your flight the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a hotel! I had never been in an Aloft hotel before this visit! I saw it online and I thought it looked interesting, so I booked it instead of the other usual hotels near airports I often choose. I was leaving the next day to go back to USA and my boyfriend was staying in Canada for the summer to be with his family, so I wanted a place that would keep me upbeat and happy! Something different, and this was that! When we walked in, I loved it! The lobby and the view of the bar and the lounge area were very mod and chic! I continued to browse the area and I found the workout room and the pool to be equally awesome! Our room was incredible! Very roomy and clean! Oh, and the bed was the most heavenly dream cloud! Next to our bed was the cutest old fashioned alarm clock! I want to find one just like it for my home. The tv was a full entertainment system! We felt like we were in the movie theater in a bed!! Awesome!! The bathroom was great - giant shower! We had drinks in the bar and they were excellent! Our waitress served us a bowl of nuts with the drinks which was so yummy!! What a great place! And a great value! I will definitely search for Aloft hotels at other locations and stay at this one again when given the chance!! Do not hesitate here! You will sleep well, and enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Aloft saved my day!”
Reviews.Author: khaijg
Reviews.Content: I don't write reviews...I don't read many either but as I type I am sitting in the lap of luxury and just felt compelled to share. I am on day 10 of a business travel schedule that took me from NY to LA, San Francisco, Vancouver, Toronto and finally Montreal. So when I arrived at the airport and was informed that my flight back to New York was cancelled I was not happy. However, immediately after booking the Aloft Hotel in Montreal, for a modest price may I add, every worry, frustration and care drifted away. This place was made with me in mind...or at least that's what I'd like to believe. The modern contemporary rooms, the ultra swanky lobby with adjoining bar, tv and pool table area and the mini mart that makes the perfect one cup cafe latte and sells travel size toiletries and Haagen Daz ice made me wonder what rock I must have been living under to not have known about this hotel Simply put this place is perfect for someone like me. Convenient, contemporary, modern and uber cute! It truly made me thankful for my cancelled flight (how often do you hear that!)...for without it I would not have discovered this trendy little haven!

Reviews.Title: “The best way to wait for your flight!”
Reviews.Author: NessyBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while waiting for an early flight and we had a blast. The hotel is very trendy and comfortable. Great outdoor - indoor lounge area near with a fireplace. Swimming pool and gym are also available as well as a pool table and free wi-fi access. You can even print your boarding pass right there at the lobby entrance while you wait for the shuttle to take you to the airport. The staff is very friendly! Will definitely do this again and again! No rush no worries, just relax and go to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel , Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: markobear1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel, traveling for a mini Montreal vacation. The hotel is conveniently located at the PT airport . The rooms were small but comfortable. Shower was the best part of the room, very roomy and well lit. The front desk staff was the best. We got help the 1st day finding transportation into Montreal from the staff and they were always there for us with smiles and good info for the rest of our stay. Noisy with the construction going on around the airport, even with the reinforced windows but not a deal breaker. I would rate this hotel a solid 3 stars ***.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here. Cool hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: The Aloft Montreal Airport is a fine place. Clean comfortable modern rooms. Located next to airport with plenty of parking. Great pool and great staff (Caroline at the front desk was great). I will book that property again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: marchbreakneeded
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aloft as a stopover hotel prior to flight out of Montreal. How cool is this hotel?? Very hip room, excellent layout. 2 free computers in lobby and although we didn't use the lobby snack, looked like anything you needed was available. The staff are excellent and very knowledgeable. The decor is very modern, chic lobby with interesting furniture. The teens loved the look-starry bar!. The room was very quiet, large and set up excellent. Very new and modern hotel. Exercise room was great. Interesting drapery in elevator. All in all, best experience at a stopover, the teens wondered if we could stay there for the week!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RoamingG
Reviews.Content: Beautiful design, large and fancy rooms. Super comfortable beds. The room windows can be completely sealed, which is awesome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Covers basics, too close to airport”
Reviews.Author: curriedrice
Reviews.Content: Aloft is Starwood's attempt to provide a basic, stylish hotel that covers basic such as internet, less expensive breakfast/food but still be stylish. The execution is weird but it can be worked with. Don't expect concierge service, breakfast is egg and some meat sandwich heated in microwave, coffee is basic. The bartender was awesome, makes good drinks, really friendly nice guy. No bathtub in room, nice shower though, no bathroom door was strange - not sure this would fly with family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A chilled hotel, right next to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Clk1969
Reviews.Content: If you've got an early flight from Montreal and you've had enough of regular chains, this is the place for you. Clean rooms, huge beds , giant flatscreen TVs, a gym, pool and a nice bar area. Alofts have a more youthful, trendy vibe and try to beak the usual chain hotel model. The only thing that can grate after a while is the constant music ( coldplay dance remixes anyone ? ) in the lobby. This is especially annoying if you're sat in the bar, and they've put American Football or Hockey on for the customers there , and the commentary is fighting with the ghastly music. We asked the barman if the music could go off for the game, but it was 'company policy' to have both on. Note to aloft - I like companies whose policies allow staff to make a call according to customers requests. Other than this minor gripe, they are trying something different here, and should be applauded for trying to inject some character into a fairly soulless business. We liked it enough to stay in an near identical aloft in Dallas - las Collinas, near DFW, too.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay! Choose room type wisely”
Reviews.Author: glacial_erratic
Reviews.Content: This is the second aLoft I have stayed at, and it was again, clean, new, modern, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful, spoke English and French interchangeably, and gave great advice on how to spend our one evening in Montreal. This time we had a king room. The room is efficient, and the bed was very comfortable. The room was basically the same as the double room I had at the aLoft in Phoenix. It has what I call "Ikea-esque" furniture, and that is fine with me. Open shelves, everything is built in, LOTS of outlets and none are behind furniture. It also has a cube fridge. The bathroom has a sliding door to seperate the sink area from the shower/toilet area, and has a cool frosted full-length window between the shower and the bedroom area. The frosted window does allow some vision into the shower, so I would be sure I was staying there with a close friend! In a double bed room, the shower window is smaller, so the "visual ability" is less. It is nice to have the light going into the shower/bathroom. The biggest difference between the double room and the king room is that the king room is just generally smaller. In some hotels, a king room is the same size as a duble, with more space around the bed and maybe a chair or something, but in the aLoft, the king room is just smaller. In the double, the bathroom vanity was very long and spacious and in the living area the couch and desk area is longer. In the king, the vanity and closet area are an OK size, just not as big as in the double. So I would stay there again, but if you want a more spacious room, go with the double.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever received at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: honesthotelreviews
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was absolutely horrendous !! Besides for the extremely rude and unaccommodating staff ; the hotel was full of little spiders and insects. The pool was closed yet this was not mentioned when we called to book our rooms. I highly recommend finding a different hotel. This hotel looks "good" from the outside but quite shabby from the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with kids...”
Reviews.Author: sumusabumom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next to the airport which is why we chose it. With 2 kids and an early morning flight, we thoght it would be a convenient and comfortable stay. Boy, was i wrong! The hotel does not have a restaurant on site and all they offer is menu's to close by cheesy delivery places. The pool was closed for repairs for a week. the hotel website did not bother to mention that at all. Our room had a huge, UGLY STAIN on the carpet, the water in the shower did NOT DRAIN well, they provided 3 towels for 4 of us and there was only 1 creamer for coffee. Obviously, the dont care much about details. Other than free Wi-Fi, the hotel doesnt offer anything of value. maybe it will work well for the business traveller, but for families, it's definitely a BAD CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: “least impressive brand of Starwood chain”
Reviews.Author: gr8trips43
Reviews.Content: As far as service, like most hotels, some employees are better than others and you are a bit disappointed when those that exceed your expectations are not working the next shift. The room resembled a cheap Ikea room, harsh minimalist, linear, without softness or curves, reminiscent of modern dorm room. The carpet was of dorm room quality complete with stains. Shower was pretty decent. This bed was adequate, not the best, but this hotel is a step down from the others in Starwood chain. It is noisy because of the airport, it is an airport hotel. Rooms do include a safe, internet/docking station, and mini-fridge. They give a complimentary bottle of water, which was not replenished during my stay. Computer printer available to print boarding passes. There is very limited food selection near front desk and at the bar at night, very limited options. Bartender was very nice, but there was an obvious fruit fly problem. Did not try pool/fitness area. Location is very far away from downtown/attractions. Take the 747 bus, a cab is around $50! It is one thing to advocate a "relaxed" culture but dressing sloppy and eating your meals at the front desk is just unprofessional. There are other hotels in the same price point and lower that offer more services. I would pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: vtfluffy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before flight. Very friendly staff,comfortable bed. Not a bad thing could I say about it. The food selection in the vending area was very good. The muffins were quality and not something you would get at airport but bakery quality. There was a free bottle of water in room. There was no street noise and the highway was right outside. Not so easy to get to but most of the hotels in that area are like that. I had a drink at bar and it was a good one. .

Reviews.Title: “European Styling, European Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Olde_biL
Reviews.Content: With the construction around Trudeau Airport (Dorval/MontrÃ©al) the first trick is just getting to the Hotel. We found the most reliable method was to cut through the lot of the adjacent Wyndham coming off the airport access road. The Aloft was a one night stay for me, two for my colleague. We had a car so were free to get meals where we liked (Schwartz's Deli and Bar-B-Barn respectively). The Canteen near the check in desk is quite limited in selection while premium in pricing. Please refer to the posted pictures as they tell most of the story. The property feels new with very European styling. I haven't traveled too, too, extensively but I was reminded of Euro-chic styled hotels I've stayed in in Germany and Austria. This was especially true of the shower with it's Gel soap and Shampoo dispensers in place of a bath soap bar and little bottle of Shampoo. The room was compact but efficient so that I didn't really feel cramped at all. The flat screen TV on the wall opposite the bed was huge, 42-inch(?) and had digital capability. However, only the in-house channels were digital, broadcast channels were all Analog - too bad. The bed was interesting, it was King width but seemed regular length. Not a problem for me, but taller guests may miss that extra 6-8 inches that are normally part of a Queen or King size bed. Check out the retro-styled Big Ben bedside alarm clock, for me it showed attention to detail in implementing the concept. One of the more interesting/unique features of the room was a 'black box' on the desk with room for you iPod/iPad/portable media device and DVI/VGA/Composite Video inputs. I never got to try this out but presume that it was connected to the Flat Screen TV. Again, see the accompanying photos. For those of you used to conventional closets, the shallow recess behind a curtain might take getting used to. For me, it's also consistent with the Euro efficiency styling of the room. Actually, I kind of missed the slot near the door where the key card usually needs to be placed to get the room lights on. One grumble about the room, the desk lighting is terrible. It's nice to be able to look out the window when at the desk but in order to work with a laptop the curtain must be pulled down almost all the way, and the desk lamp turned on. It ended up making the workspace a bit of a dark cave. Finally, in passing, I took photos of the pool and exercise room. I'm sorry that I didn't get to use the fitness equipment or the pool as both seemed inviting. I spent a couple of moments in the Courtyard and wished that I had a bit more time to enjoy that space too. For business travel, especially if a location close to the airport is desirable, I'd definitely stay here again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “funky new hotel - great idea, lacks in services though”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: i did actually enjoy staying here - it is very modernist design with great features - the rooms are somewhat basic, but actually comfortable - had a great nights sleep, bed was very comfortable. there is no restaurant on-site - only a 'self service' snack area - so not good for eating. you have to pretty much eat out and that includes breakfast if you want anything substantial. That is the only downside to this hotel. if you dont mind eating out - it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urocat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft hotel during the grand prix, the price was fair and the room was neat and clean. The service left a little to be desired and they charge a fee for parking.

Reviews.Title: “For families - no thank you. For business - excellent.”
Reviews.Author: franticreviewer
Reviews.Content: Some background is necessary before this - I stayed with my fiancee, her 12-year-old, and my 14- and 16-year-olds. We stayed in two adjacent rooms and rigged the connecting door open by either jamming towels in or fiddling with the handle, because it would not open into the other room properly. The lobby and our rooms smelled of perfume with a dash of herbs, which was somewhat unpleasant but remedied when we asked for the rooms to be aired out. We also requested a cot, but were told that they were not available because the clientele of the hotel is more business-oriented. I asked, jokingly, if it would then be more advisable to bring my secretary than my children, and was told that it was. The decor and the amenities in the room all speak to this being a man's hotel, from the flat-screen television to the "fake closet" as my daughter called it, to the lack of a restaurant (only an overpriced grab-and-go section with lots of peppers in the food in the lobby) but an impressive bar. The beds were stiff and large, and the covers were difficult to maneuver. The decor in the room was, well, odd - for example, a purposefully plasticky retro alarm clock and colorblocked blinds; fake plush panels behind the bed of cork, and, in one room, cow fur; a prominent recycling bin but only a pithy, small garbage bin in the bathroom. Despite how unflattering the above may be, it's not a bad hotel. It's just not for families. It has a definite goal and a definite aesthetic (despite what the Disney flashcards for sale in the lobby might say) and this might not appeal to some. It wasn't my thing, but it could definitely be someone else's.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AND DIFFERENT...”
Reviews.Author: Merrick1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft recently and loved it. I had my kids who are 2 and 4 and they loved the hotel aswell. The staff is very nice and helpful, and the pool is great. Location was perfect for us. Lots of neat things at the hotel and free wifi which is always a plus. Can't wait to go back someday...

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: traveller910693
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the alfot on April 23 rd and again on May 1st, 2010. Was catching flights from Montreal. Was travelling alone with a young child. There was no-one to help with luggages on both occasions and on May 1st, there were even no cart to help with luggages. I foudn the rooms very well kept but the service lacking big time. If you are adult-only travellers and do not need help with your luggages that may be a great place to stay but if you appreciate the service and help with your luggages, I do not think this is the best place to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very hard to find”
Reviews.Author: torontotraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aloft for two nights. I reserved this hotel through Hotwire, with the parameters of the Pointe Claire/Dorval area. The good part-the hotel is beautiful-relatively new and very trendy. NIce lobby with a bar and internet. There is a good fitness area and indoor pool. The rooms are very smart looking-nice linens and toiletries, wall mounted big screen TV, comfortable beds, nice bathroom and a bar fridge. The staff was always very cheery, and helpful. The housekeeping staff was very thorough and accomodating. The bad part-this hotel is extremely hard to find on your own. Our GPS did not recognize the hotel and when we input the address our GPS system had a hard time directing us to the place. The problem is that the road system near the airport ( and this hotel is minutes from P.E. Trudeau airport) is very convoluted and complicated. Not the hotel's fault-just reality. So I would hightly recommend this hotel if you are staying just to access the airport. The hotel does provide a shuttle to the airport. I would NOT recommend this hotel if you are planning on travelling to and from Montreal. The road system in that area is just too crazy and the signs are hard to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Take a PASS You'll Spend Eternity in a Tomb! Choose a Real Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocksolidNH
Reviews.Content: Imagine a cement coffin with two small windows and room decorations selected by a 7th grader throw in every imaginable noise from down the hall or above and youâ€™ll have a night in hell compliments of the Aloft Montreal Airport! My wife and I spent over $100 to stay at this â€œtrendyâ€� as some would describe it but for me itâ€™s much easier just to call it what it truly is â€œhorribleâ€�. The rooms are like a cement mausoleum, the ceiling is raw cement and any and every noise from the guest above is echoed through your torture chamber. The only thing louder than the sounds from outside your room is the screaming from all the fake wood or design â€œala wood laminateâ€�. The sink has no visible control to adjust the water level and until you by chance figure out that you must reach down under the water and push it physically to release it. You just canâ€™t get away from the feeling that you are in a cold four walled cement tomb it is by far todayâ€™s version of the shagged carpeted â€œno-tell motelâ€� that you visited in college only now you should know better. The only good thing I can say is that there is a nice TV for the hours youâ€™ll be awake because you wonâ€™t be able to sleep! So just say â€œNOâ€� to this poorly designed excuse for a hotel. Iâ€™ve traveled the world for over 30 years and I have never stayed at a place Iâ€™d rate any lower than the Aloft Montreal Airport

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACPOW
Reviews.Content: Only got to spend 6hrs at the hotel, Modern rooms, With self serve food and breakfast in the lobby. Hotel staff were great. Airport location.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to live there forever...except for the fact that Id have to drive in Montreal all day”
Reviews.Author: LauraandChrisE
Reviews.Content: This was one beautiful hotel. When you first enter the doors of this sweet deal, you're instantantly hit with this wonderful smell in the lobby. You see the really beautiful contemporary furnature, fireplace, pool table, complete with it's own little art galary. The staff will go to any lengths to help you out. The pool is SOOOO warrrrmmmm, you can just walk right into it. The rooms are soooo clean, stylish, beds are beautiful, sooo comfortable. I did not notice the planes AT ALL. I wish I could move into this place. I can't strees enough how wonderful it is. I stayed there with my husband and two young children, and we had a truly wonderful experience. The only problem, and it's not the hotels fault at all, technology hasn't cought up with this establishment's location yet. I programed my gps to find the place, and I was circling montreal off and on ramps like a madwoman... This is NOT at fault of the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by new roads, and is still waiting for the maps, etc to catch up. Make sure you ask the front desk staff what co ordinates you need to enter into your gps if needed. If you know montreal, then you probably won't have any issue's finding the place. I however am a Montreal noob, therefore, probably contributing to my highway confusion. STAY AT THIS PLACE!!! Show your CAA card to get a discount!!!! Omgoodness, I forgot to mention the beautiful walk in showers!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!! Anyone who has dissed this place above, PLEASE IGNORE THEM!!!!! Take it from someone who stays at hotels freequently thoughout the year, at all different types of places. This is the place to stay when in montreal Great value, great price, SWEET PLACE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice and love it!”
Reviews.Author: heatherdcl
Reviews.Content: It's not perfect but we like the concept. The rooms are stylish, comfortable and clean. The gym and pool are top notch. The lobby is welcoming and comfortable for a drink or dinner. Yes! There's plenty of seating, a bar with friendly bar tenders and tables at which to eat dinner. Now, the downside is that there is no dining room or even one within walking distance if, like us, you are without a car. On our first stay we ordered in dinner and it was horrible. So this time we brought a microwaveable dinner ( a really good one, not junk food) and our own wine for the bar tender to open, which she did happily. There's a microwave at the snack bar in the lobby. As a matter of fact, we were encouraged by the hotel to do all of the above. Our senior rate was excellent so we flew out of Dorval the next morning for Grand Cayman with more cash in pocket than we would have at other airport hotels. OK. I'm frugal, but I live well, travel lots and like good hotels. My only complaint is that a friend left two phone messages and we did not get either. She fumed about the lack of a real person to talk to on the automated answering system.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShoxBoy
Reviews.Content: The feeling was a "Ikea" inspired W Hotel, which is not a bad thing. It was very functional. Even thought the hotel was beside the airport, I didn't find that it was that noisy. It seems that Aloft hotels are rated as a 3-3.5 star hotel, which I find it the quality to me exceed other similar level hotels that I have stayed in before. I am picky on the cleanliness of hotel rooms whenever I find rooms for my trips. But when I walked into the room, I found it to be clean, maybe because this hotel is about 1 yrs old. Since this hotel was new, finding the hotel on your GPS or Google Maps was a bit tricky as they don't have the roads mapped out yet. But it is close to the highways which can take you into the city pretty quickly. Free internet and parking was a bonus. Plus there was a free pool table to relax and hang around in the lounge. The only issues was one front desk staff that was not that helpful when asking for directions and the snack bar is a bit on the expensive side for food & beverage items. But overall, I would stay there again and for travelling to other locations I would prefer to stay in the Aloft chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbruins
Reviews.Content: Great looking hotel... Very cool shower. It gets noisy early in the morning because of the planes, but it's normal, being right next to the airport. A great place to spend the night before a flight...

Reviews.Title: “OK, but this hotel tries too hard”
Reviews.Author: Wakky_J
Reviews.Content: 1st, it's a fine hotel. I know my rating is a little low, but there were a few things that frustrated me with the hotel, and as a result I lowered my rating. The rooms were clean, the staff was very friendly, and the decor is nice. But they try so hard to be "funky, hip and cool" that they lose the ability to be practical. Some examples for you. They place the face cloths in the sink area, and the hand towels in the shower area. Then, once I fetch a hand towel, I have no place to hang it up in the sink area. It ends up lying on the counter beside the sink. The "closet" to hang up your clothes consists of a 10 inch bar at a 45 degree angle and little knobs down the bar to catch the hangars. It looks nice and takes up very little room, but try using it! It's impossible to manage the cloths on this bar. And finally, you're going to shake your head at me for this, but you know how all hotels give you a pad of paper and a pen to write with? Well here they still give you the paper, but instead of a pen they give you a pencil. Yah, a pencil. Try writting a postcard with a pencil and then mailing it. All these things are meant to be inline with the brand, but I didn't care for it. Plus, there was a problem with the bill (1 night stay with no incidentals, and they make a mistake). It was taken care of, but it was just another frustration I had to deal with 5 minutes before the shuttle leaves. Oh, and that's another thing. The shuttle. If you stay here, DO NOT stand at the "hotel shuttle" post outside the airport. They don't stop here (after 20 minutes of waiting I figured it out). They stop at post #2 called "Parking and Via Rail" and arrive about every 15 minutes or so. There is a free phone beside the baggage claim to the hotel. There is coffee in your room, but only enough to make 1 cup of regular coffee, or one cup of decaf. You may have to share. And one last thing, do your research for food. Their selection is very limited and quite expensive. We ended up eating at the airport on arrival and departure days. Sorry so negative here when the other posts are so possitive. I guess this is a great hotel for some people, but I was just frustrated by it. Although at $105 it was the cheapest one around.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the W, but a neat hotel nonetheless!”
Reviews.Author: mcadrenaline
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in early July 2009 off of a PL bid. My rate was roughly half of the going rate on the hotel's own website. The shuttle service is great, but VERY confusing. It took me an hour to figure out! You need to take the Hotel Aeroport blue bus, fromt the first curb at baggage claim. The bus is NOT marked aLoft, which is completely stupid, but it does go there. After that fiasco, I arrived at the hotel. Checked in using the self kiosk with no probelm, and it even let me select my own room (I put myself in a corner room on floor 3) The decor is very eclectic and chic. I can't really explain it but the photos on the web will give you a good idea. Rooms are small, but the use of space is FANTASTIC and there are 2 big windows. Free internet and local calls. BLISS bath amenities. Wall mounted TV (only english channel is CNN). There is a nice indoor pool and courtyard with contemporary furniture. The biggest downfall to this hotel was location. It's SUPER convenient to the airport, but a disaster for everything else. You CANNOT walk ANYWHERE since it is pretty much locked in by freeway ramps. No restaurants to walk to....I had to order pizza. You can take their shuttle to a crappy mall with a supermarket and some decent food (I ate at Thai Express) and to the VIA Rail station. The bus into Montreal city leaves from an adjacent station next to VIA Rail. MAKE SURE YOU KNOW HOW TO FIND AND USE THE BUS!!!! I CAN NOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH!!! The Metro drivers speak little English and it is very confusing since there are many buses going many places from 1 curb.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, trendy hotel for stopovers at Dorval”
Reviews.Author: fs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as I was connecting early in the morning for a flight; booked last minute and got a good deal ($79) and was a happy to pay a few more dollars than some other hotels in the area to stay on airport property at a trendy new hotel. The lobby is really nice and cozy, with a bar and internet terminals. The check-in staff were extremely friendly, asked what time we wanted a wake-up call at, and were generally just very chill and laid back, while still being attentive. The rooms are nice, with typically comfortable Starwood beds. As other reviewers have mentioned, the wall unit heater is a little noisy and had to work hard on a cold Montreal night, but it wasn't a big deal. The rooms are very modern, very "un-hotel" and overall a very cool place to stay. This was my first Aloft and I can't wait to stay at another. I highly recommend it for Dorval - you can't quite walk into the airport, but the shuttle is frequent, and the airport is literally 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place”
Reviews.Author: nimeria
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed two nights at Aloftt MontrÃ©al for $60/night through a priceline bid. We just came from a horrible experience at the hotel we stayed at in Niagara Falls so it was so refreshing to stay at Aloft. The staff were absolutely pleasant. We got lost on the way to hotel and they patiently helped us navigate to the hotel via cell phone. Everybody was warm and very friendly. We adored our two Queen size bedroom. It was well decorated with contemporary furniture. We definitely appreciated how everything in the hotel was SUPER CLEAN. Even the washrooms near the workout room and pool were clean. Most of all, we loved how thick the walls were. My son had a breakdown in the middle of the night and you couldn't even hear it through the door (my husband went out the room to check if he could hear the baby from outside). We loved the so much that we booked two nights at an Aloft at a different location for full price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogueofhope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just love this hotel. We will definately come back. It is a futruistic looking hotel. The staff are all very friendly and willing to help you out. The rooms are very clean.Although they are alittle smaller than other hotel rooms, the furniture and setting makes it very functional and chic. Also good for business travelers. All the rooms have a huge LCD TV mounted to the wall. You have wired and wireless internent.You can even hook up your laptop to the LCD TV for better viewing. Great way to way free movies through your laptop. Near the lobby they is a selection of snack and sandwiches. They taste really good but alittle expensive. They do provide a microwave and hot water, so if you want to save money, bring some non-perishable food. The elevaters are super fast too. I was able to get this hotel through priceline for $60/night by bidding.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Jetstream1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aloft for 3 nights during a short visit to MontrÃ©al to visit friends and relatives. Whenever I am visiting big cities with a rental car I book hotels near or at the airport because the rates, convenience and ample parking (and I am also an airline 'enthusiast'). Without traffic (even though this is a rare occurance) Its only a 20 minute drive to downtown MontrÃ©al. When we stepped in the lobby after a long drive from Rochester NY we felt like we just walked into 'Chalum's Cantina' (fictional Bar in Star Wars Movies) on the Planet 'Tatooine', expecting to see Aliens from the entire Universe sitting around the Lava Lamps sipping Out-of-this-world-cocktails. The dÃ©cor, the music (not too loud â€“ just perfect) and the lighting created the perfect urban, hip Disco/Dance/Chill atmosphere. You feel relaxed almost immediately. I was never surprised by any Hotel Lobby in such a way. Check-in was smooth, relaxed and in 2 minutes we had the key-cards to our 2 rooms on the 4th floor. I cannot go too much into details about this hotel, otherwise this review would be several pages long. The room was, especially the setup, was very unusual and quite smart as well. There is almost nothing to complain about this hotel, even though I always find something. It is by far the most interesting 3-star Airport Hotel I have ever stayed at â€“ right down to the smallest details! (biggest flat screen TV's, softest toilet paper, biggest (rain-)showers, etc. etc.). What a refreshing change to the stuffy, old fashioned Seventies Time-warp Hotels like Quality and Comfort Inns, Econolodes, Motel 6, Travelodges, etc.! If you are looking for a good Downtown location â€“ forget it! Otherwise the Aloft is THE hotel to stay at in Montreal â€“ Try it! You will like it!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: Alicetas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here en route to another destination and was happily surprised to find a different hotel. I liked the 24 hr fitness room and the bar was good. Shuttles run to and from the airport every 15 minutes. I didn't want to wait the 15 minutes and asked the staff member to call me a cab. She was a little put out by this and claimed my 5 minute ride would be 3 times the actual rate. Except for this silly grumpy am staffer - the visit was comfortable and I will be stopping in again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky place for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: trevh47
Reviews.Content: We needed a convienent place to stay near the airport, and made our choice based on the feedback we read here. We enjoyed the layout and the decor - really refreshing from the standard fair in most hotels. We checked in close to midnight and it was very quick - much appreciated after a long day of travel. I've already recommended this place to a few friends who travel on business, and I will be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, sleek, relaxing - a good deal near the airport”
Reviews.Author: WeekendWanderer11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times now and have always had a really positive experience. The rooms are comfortable, clean, modern. Free wi-fi. No there isn't a restaurant, but you can get apps at the bar, and there is a vast selection of takeout menus at the front desk. The wxyz bar has a number of really fun cocktails and a good atmosphere. It was hopping on the Saturday night I was there. Pool area and gym are very nice - love the personal TVs in the cardio machines. Getting to the airport is a breeze with the free shuttle - it can take you to the local bus to go downtown. Friendly staff. I would recommend for travellers of all kinds. Has a great look and a great modern feel and is a good deal compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - just by the airport”
Reviews.Author: ombrelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night and used their version of 'Park, stay, and fly'. We were able to leave our car for one week and use their shuttle service. The room had one really comfy king bed, mini fridge, alarm clock, coffee machine, one bottle of water, a real plug in blow dryer, magazines, numeric safe. There wasn't much closet space, so nat ideal for long stays. Only 4 hangers. The fan on the heat/air unit is noisy, but that kept the airplane noise to a minimum.
